metadata.title: CVE-2021-33656 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
When setting font with malicous data by ioctl cmd PIO_FONT,kernel willwrite memory out of bounds.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-33656` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-234-generic - 4.4.0-234.268
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-234-generic - 4.4.0-234.268
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-234-lowlatency - 4.4.0-234.268
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-192-generic - 4.15.0-192.203~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-192-generic - 4.15.0-192.203~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-192-lowlatency - 4.15.0-192.203~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1114-kvm - 4.4.0-1114.124
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1150-aws - 4.4.0-1150.165
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1140-aws - 4.15.0-1140.151~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1150-azure - 4.15.0-1150.165~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1135-gcp - 4.15.0-1135.151~16.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1105-oracle - 4.15.0-1105.116~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-234.268').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-192.203~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1114.124').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1150.165').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1140.151~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1150.165~16.04.1').
linux-fips: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1135.151~16.04.2').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1105.116~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
